trans-unit.source: Exploring Metrics in Application Insights
trans-unit.target: Exploring Metrics in Application Insights

trans-unit.source: Analyze usage, availability and performance of your on-premises or Microsoft Azure web application with Application Insights.
trans-unit.target: Analyze usage, availability and performance of your on-premises or Microsoft Azure web application with Application Insights.

trans-unit.source: Metrics in <linkText>Application Insights[start]</linkText><title></title> are measured values and counts of events that are sent in telemetry from your application.
trans-unit.target: Metrics in <linkText>Application Insights[start]</linkText><title></title> are measured values and counts of events that are sent in telemetry from your application.

trans-unit.source: They help you detect performance issues and watch trends in how your application is being used.
trans-unit.target: They help you detect performance issues and watch trends in how your application is being used.

trans-unit.source: There's a wide range of standard metrics, and you can also create your own custom metrics and events.
trans-unit.target: There's a wide range of standard metrics, and you can also create your own custom metrics and events.

trans-unit.source: Metrics and event counts are displayed in charts of aggregated values such as sums, averages, or counts.
trans-unit.target: Metrics and event counts are displayed in charts of aggregated values such as sums, averages, or counts.

trans-unit.source: Here's a sample chart:
trans-unit.target: Here's a sample chart:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Open the overview blade of your application in the Azure portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Open the overview blade of your application in the Azure portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Some charts are segmented: the total height of the chart at any point is the sum of the metrics displayed.
trans-unit.target: Some charts are segmented: the total height of the chart at any point is the sum of the metrics displayed.

trans-unit.source: The legend by default shows the largest quantities.
trans-unit.target: The legend by default shows the largest quantities.

trans-unit.source: Dotted lines show the value of the metric one week previously.
trans-unit.target: Dotted lines show the value of the metric one week previously.

trans-unit.source: You can change the Time range covered by the charts or grids on any blade.
trans-unit.target: You can change the Time range covered by the charts or grids on any blade.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Open the overview blade of your application in the Azure portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Open the overview blade of your application in the Azure portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you're expecting some data that hasn't appeared yet, click Refresh.
trans-unit.target: If you're expecting some data that hasn't appeared yet, click Refresh.

trans-unit.source: Charts refresh themselves at intervals, but the intervals are longer for larger time ranges.
trans-unit.target: Charts refresh themselves at intervals, but the intervals are longer for larger time ranges.

trans-unit.source: In release mode, it can take a while for data to come through the analysis pipeline onto a chart.
trans-unit.target: In release mode, it can take a while for data to come through the analysis pipeline onto a chart.

trans-unit.source: To zoom into part of a chart, drag over it and then click the magnifier symbol:
trans-unit.target: To zoom into part of a chart, drag over it and then click the magnifier symbol:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Drag across part of a chart.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Drag across part of a chart.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Hover your mouse over the chart to display the values of the metrics at that point.
trans-unit.target: Hover your mouse over the chart to display the values of the metrics at that point.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Hover the mouse over a chart</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Hover the mouse over a chart</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The value of the metric at a particular point is aggregated over the preceding sampling interval.
trans-unit.target: The value of the metric at a particular point is aggregated over the preceding sampling interval.

trans-unit.source: The sampling interval or "granularity" is shown at the top of the blade.
trans-unit.target: The sampling interval or "granularity" is shown at the top of the blade.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>The header of a blade.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>The header of a blade.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can adjust the granularity in the Time range blade:
trans-unit.target: You can adjust the granularity in the Time range blade:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>The header of a blade.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>The header of a blade.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The granularities available depend on the time range you select.
trans-unit.target: The granularities available depend on the time range you select.

trans-unit.source: The explicit granularities are alternatives to the "automatic" granularity for the time range.
trans-unit.target: The explicit granularities are alternatives to the "automatic" granularity for the time range.

trans-unit.source: Click through any chart on the overview blade to see a more detailed set of related charts and grids.
trans-unit.target: Click through any chart on the overview blade to see a more detailed set of related charts and grids.

trans-unit.source: You can edit these charts and grids to focus on the details you're interested in.
trans-unit.target: You can edit these charts and grids to focus on the details you're interested in.

trans-unit.source: For example, click through the web app's Failed Requests chart:
trans-unit.target: For example, click through the web app's Failed Requests chart:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>On the overview blade, click a chart</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>On the overview blade, click a chart</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The legend at the side by default shows the aggregated value over the period of the chart.
trans-unit.target: The legend at the side by default shows the aggregated value over the period of the chart.

trans-unit.source: Each data point on the chart is also an aggregate of the data values received in the preceding sampling interval or "granularity".
trans-unit.target: Each data point on the chart is also an aggregate of the data values received in the preceding sampling interval or "granularity".

trans-unit.source: The granularity is shown at the top of the blade, and varies with the overall timescale of the chart.
trans-unit.target: The granularity is shown at the top of the blade, and varies with the overall timescale of the chart.

trans-unit.source: Different metrics are aggregated in different ways:
trans-unit.target: Different metrics are aggregated in different ways:

trans-unit.source: For a metric such as response time, values are averaged over the period of the chart.
trans-unit.target: For a metric such as response time, values are averaged over the period of the chart.

trans-unit.source: For counts of events such as failed requests, the aggregate is the sum of counts over the period.
trans-unit.target: For counts of events such as failed requests, the aggregate is the sum of counts over the period.

trans-unit.source: For counts of users, the aggregate is the number of unique users over the period.
trans-unit.target: For counts of users, the aggregate is the number of unique users over the period.

trans-unit.source: (If a user is tracked more than once in the period, they are counted only once.)
trans-unit.target: (If a user is tracked more than once in the period, they are counted only once.)

trans-unit.source: To find out whether the value is a sum, average, or unique click the chart and scroll down to the selected value.
trans-unit.target: To find out whether the value is a sum, average, or unique click the chart and scroll down to the selected value.

trans-unit.source: You can also get a short description of the metric.
trans-unit.target: You can also get a short description of the metric.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Hover over (i)</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Hover over (i)</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To add a new chart to the blade:
trans-unit.target: To add a new chart to the blade:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>In Metrics Explorer, choose Add Chart</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>In Metrics Explorer, choose Add Chart</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select an existing or new chart to edit what it shows:
trans-unit.target: Select an existing or new chart to edit what it shows:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Select one or more metrics</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select one or more metrics</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can display more than one metric on a chart, though there are restrictions about the combinations that can be displayed together.
trans-unit.target: You can display more than one metric on a chart, though there are restrictions about the combinations that can be displayed together.

trans-unit.source: As soon as you choose one metric, some of the others are disabled.
trans-unit.target: As soon as you choose one metric, some of the others are disabled.

trans-unit.source: If you coded <linkText>custom metrics[track]</linkText><title></title> into your app (calls to TrackMetric and TrackEvent) they will be listed here.
trans-unit.target: If you coded <linkText>custom metrics[track]</linkText><title></title> into your app (calls to TrackMetric and TrackEvent) they will be listed here.

trans-unit.source: Select a chart or grid, switch on grouping and pick a property to group by:
trans-unit.target: Select a chart or grid, switch on grouping and pick a property to group by:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Select Grouping On, then set select a property in Group By</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select Grouping On, then set select a property in Group By</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you coded <linkText>custom metrics[track]</linkText><title></title> into your app and they include property values, you'll be able to select the property in the list.
trans-unit.target: If you coded <linkText>custom metrics[track]</linkText><title></title> into your app and they include property values, you'll be able to select the property in the list.

trans-unit.source: Is the chart too small for segmented data?
trans-unit.target: Is the chart too small for segmented data?

trans-unit.source: Adjust its height:
trans-unit.target: Adjust its height:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Adjust the slider</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Adjust the slider</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To see just the metrics for a selected set of property values:
trans-unit.target: To see just the metrics for a selected set of property values:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Click Filter, expand a property, and check some values</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Click Filter, expand a property, and check some values</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you don't select any values for a particular property, it's the same as selecting them all: there is no filter on that property.
trans-unit.target: If you don't select any values for a particular property, it's the same as selecting them all: there is no filter on that property.

trans-unit.source: Notice the counts of events alongside each property value.
trans-unit.target: Notice the counts of events alongside each property value.

trans-unit.source: When you select values of one property, the counts alongside other property values are adjusted.
trans-unit.target: When you select values of one property, the counts alongside other property values are adjusted.

trans-unit.source: Use the filter Real or synthetic traffic and check Real.
trans-unit.target: Use the filter Real or synthetic traffic and check Real.

trans-unit.source: You can also filter by Source of synthetic traffic.
trans-unit.target: You can also filter by Source of synthetic traffic.

trans-unit.source: In particular, notice that you can switch between grids and graphs:
trans-unit.target: In particular, notice that you can switch between grids and graphs:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Select a grid or graph, then choose a chart type</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select a grid or graph, then choose a chart type</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When you've created some charts, save them as a favorite.
trans-unit.target: When you've created some charts, save them as a favorite.

trans-unit.source: You can choose whether to share it with other team members, if you use an organizational account.
trans-unit.target: You can choose whether to share it with other team members, if you use an organizational account.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Choose Favorite</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Choose Favorite</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To see the blade again, go to the overview blade and open Favorites:
trans-unit.target: To see the blade again, go to the overview blade and open Favorites:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>In the Overview blade, choose Favorites</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>In the Overview blade, choose Favorites</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you chose Relative time range when you saved, the blade will be updated with the latest metrics.
trans-unit.target: If you chose Relative time range when you saved, the blade will be updated with the latest metrics.

trans-unit.source: If you chose Absolute time range, it will show the same data every time.
trans-unit.target: If you chose Absolute time range, it will show the same data every time.

trans-unit.source: If you edit a blade but then you'd like to get back to the original saved set, just click Reset.
trans-unit.target: If you edit a blade but then you'd like to get back to the original saved set, just click Reset.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>In the buttons at the top of Metric Explorer</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>In the buttons at the top of Metric Explorer</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To be notified by email of unusual values of any metric, add an alert.
trans-unit.target: To be notified by email of unusual values of any metric, add an alert.

trans-unit.source: You can choose either to send the email to the account administrators, or to specific email addresses.
trans-unit.target: You can choose either to send the email to the account administrators, or to specific email addresses.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>In Metrics Explorer, choose Alert rules, Add Alert</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>In Metrics Explorer, choose Alert rules, Add Alert</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Learn more about alerts[alerts]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Learn more about alerts[alerts]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can export metric data that is displayed in Metric Explorer to an Excel file.
trans-unit.target: You can export metric data that is displayed in Metric Explorer to an Excel file.

trans-unit.source: The exported data includes data from all charts and tables as seen in the portal.
trans-unit.target: The exported data includes data from all charts and tables as seen in the portal.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>In Metrics Explorer, choose Alert rules, Add Alert</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>In Metrics Explorer, choose Alert rules, Add Alert</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The data for each chart or table is exported to a separate sheet in the Excel file.
trans-unit.target: The data for each chart or table is exported to a separate sheet in the Excel file.

trans-unit.source: What you see is what gets exported.
trans-unit.target: What you see is what gets exported.

trans-unit.source: Change the time range or filters if you want to change the range of data exported.
trans-unit.target: Change the time range or filters if you want to change the range of data exported.

trans-unit.source: For tables, if the load more command is showing, you can click it before you click Export, to have more data exported.
trans-unit.target: For tables, if the load more command is showing, you can click it before you click Export, to have more data exported.

trans-unit.source: *Export works only for Internet Explorer and Chrome at present.
trans-unit.target: *Export works only for Internet Explorer and Chrome at present.

trans-unit.source: We’re working on adding support for other browsers.*
trans-unit.target: We’re working on adding support for other browsers.*

trans-unit.source: If you want data continuously exported so that you can process it externally, consider using <linkText>Continous export</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you want data continuously exported so that you can process it externally, consider using <linkText>Continous export</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If you want even richer views of your data, you can <linkText>export to Power BI</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you want even richer views of your data, you can <linkText>export to Power BI</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Monitoring usage with Application Insights</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Monitoring usage with Application Insights</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Using Diagnostic Search</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Using Diagnostic Search</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: app-insights-alerts.md
